title: Since I missed the great QnA about illoui....
body: ...what does she think of ekko? in motion or reverse?

replies.body:
I'm not so sure that Ekko is in motion currently. For a guy who clearly has issues with Piltover and dislikes what certain Zaunites have done to his city, he's not really doing anything about it. And he certainly has the potential to do something!

Ekko probably needs something to really set him in motion, and I think Illaoi's test would be one heck of a kickstart. I do think he'd pass the test though!

> [{quoted}](name=Riot ShadowStorm,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=qOUo9xAK,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-11-25T19:20:45.488+0000)

> I'm not so sure that Ekko is in motion currently. For a guy who clearly has issues with Piltover and dislikes what certain Zaunites have done to his city, he's not really doing anything about it. And he certainly has the potential to do something!
> 
> Ekko probably needs something to really set him in motion, and I think Illaoi's test would be one heck of a kickstart. I do think he'd pass the test though!

What about someone like Riven, who is marching ahead despite her great losses, and trying to find a way to reforge Noxus?  She certainly has a very powerful spirit, she reforges her blade, and even stuns people with her spiritual power.  I'm wondering if her resolve to change things qualifies her as being in motion.

> [{quoted}](name=Ryugi Kazamaru,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=qOUo9xAK,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2015-11-25T19:42:02.328+0000)
>
> What about someone like Riven, who is marching ahead despite her great losses, and trying to find a way to reforge Noxus?  She certainly has a very powerful spirit, she reforges her blade, and even stuns people with her spiritual power.  I'm wondering if her resolve to change things qualifies her as being in motion.

I think it depends on how you view Riven. The way you described her, it sounds like she's in motion.

Personally, I see Riven as somebody who's a little lost right now. She had conviction once, but that's since been shattered. And nothing has replaced it (yet). In my mind, Riven could benefit from some clarity and purpose. Less dwelling on the past, more driving towards reforging what is broken.

I feel she'd dislike him due to his inability to adapt to the situation properly. This might just be how I view it, but rather than taking the hits that life swings like the rest of us, he presses the redo button to put it in his favor. 

Obviously he wants to do good with what he can do, I just think he has problems accepting things and moving on. Which makes sense, given his environment and the fact that he's a teenager.

> [{quoted}](name=Ralanr,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=qOUo9xAK,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-11-25T19:35:07.737+0000)
>
> I just think he has problems accepting things and moving on. Which makes sense, given his environment and the fact that he's a teenager.

I think this is very true for Ekko right now, and this is the kind of stagnation that Illaoi wouldn't appreciate. Swim forward, or drown.

Not sure how she'd feel about the Z-Drive in general though - maybe it's ok, as long as you're using it to (ultimately) move forward? I don't really know... WAAARGHbobo or Jaredan might have some thoughts on this!
